fields.summary: fix bootstrapStandby race condition introduced in HDFS-5080

fields.description:
Currently when QJM is used, running BootstrapStandby while the existing NN is active can get the following exception:
{code}
FATAL ha.BootstrapStandby: Unable to read transaction ids 6175397-6175405 from the configured shared edits storage. Please copy these logs into the shared edits storage or call saveNamespace on the active node.
Error: Gap in transactions. Expected to be able to read up until at least txid 6175405 but unable to find any edit logs containing txid 6175405
java.io.IOException: Gap in transactions. Expected to be able to read up until at least txid 6175405 but unable to find any edit logs containing txid 6175405
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.FSEditLog.checkForGaps(FSEditLog.java:1300)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.FSEditLog.selectInputStreams(FSEditLog.java:1258)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.ha.BootstrapStandby.checkLogsAvailableForRead(BootstrapStandby.java:229)
{code}

Looks like the cause of the exception is that, when the active NN is queries by BootstrapStandby about the last written transaction ID, the in-progress edit log segment is included. However, when journal nodes are asked about the last written transaction ID, in-progress edit log is excluded. This causes BootstrapStandby#checkLogsAvailableForRead to complain gaps. 

To fix this, we can either let journal nodes take into account the in-progress editlog, or let active NN exclude the in-progress edit log segment.
fields.summary: BootstrapStandby not working with QJM when the existing NN is active

comments.body: Initial patch for review. In the patch the journal node can include the highest txid of the in-progress edit log in the edit manifest, if the corresponding request is not for loading/reading editlog. The in-progress editlog segment will still be ignored if forReading is true.

  against trunk revision .

Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/4794//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshadoop-hdfs.html

This message is automatically generated.

Fix the FindBug warning. 

I tested the BootstrapStandby in a local cluster. With the patch BootstrapStandby could work with QJM when the existing NN is active. I may try to add a unit test about it if necessary.

The patch looks good. +1. One minor comment -  Instead of inProgressOk, is "includeInProgress" a better name?

This code with parameters such as forReading, inProgressOk, and their relationship seems quite confusing. Given that RemoteEditLog gives if a segment is in progress, one could return all the editlog segments to the client. The client can choose to use the appropriate editlog segments. This cleanup can be done in a separate jira.
It would probably be better to send the lastCommittedTxId, instead of the lastWrittenTxId. Otherwise it may respond with a entry which has not yet made it to a quorum of nodes.

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12597544/HDFS-5080.001.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

This message is automatically generated.

Thanks for the comments, Suresh and Todd! Update the patch to add a unit test, which tests BootstrapStandby with QJM when the existing NN is in either active or standby state.

bq. It would probably be better to send the lastCommittedTxId, instead of the lastWrittenTxId.

Looks like currently the committedTxnId in JournalNodes gets updated before new edits are written in JN, thus its value is less than the committedTxId recorded in the client side (i.e., IPCLoggerChannel#committedTxId). If we want to use lastCommittedTxId instead of lastWrittenTxId, we may have to use IPCLoggerChannel#committedTxId. But this will be inconsistent with other non-QJM cases.

If we still use lastWrittenTxId here, we may fail to detect gaps in some cases, which I think are usually happening when editlog is being written while bootstrapStandby is going on? If we can assume this is not a common scenario, maybe we can still use lastWrittenTxId here?

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12597659/HDFS-5080.002.patch
  against trunk revision .
